oai_dc:dc.dc:title: Letter from Confederate Wiley Bartlette at Vicksburg
oai_dc:dc.dc:description: Sgt. Bartlette was from Claiborne Co. and served in Co. H, 61st TN Mtd. Inf. He is writing his wife Sallie from Vicksburg: "Sallie I want to know whether you have killed your hogs or knott. Sallie I hope I will see you one time more." He writes, "Only; harde times we have�knothing to eat in Miss but corn meal without sifting and beef so poor that a dog wouldn't hardly eat it." Speaking of the deteriorating Confederate situation in Vicksburg, he says there is "sickness in our regement."
